column4: Come out to @SouthPlainsMall and visit with two of our finest LPD recruiters!! They’re set up between Dillard’s and Bath & Body Works near the main east side entrance! They’ll be here until 6 p.m.!
Can’t make it inside for Coffee at the Arches? Don’t worry, our very own Officer Chacon is working the drive thru!! Swing by and say hi at the McDonald’s on Slide & 82nd!
Make sure to come on out this morning! Grab some coffee, engage in some conversation and meet Raider Red!!

Tomorrow morning while you’re chatting it up with a first responder over some hot coffee at Coffee at the Arches, have your young ones get their picture and finger prints done with the LPD Child ID Kit!

Have you ever wondered about applying to be a police officer with the City of Lubbock? Tomorrow, during Coffee at the Arches and at the South Plains Mall, a few of our recruiting officers will be available to answer any and all questions you might have! Come on out!!
Come on out tomorrow and get some coffee while talking to some of your first responders! Coffee at the Arches is taking place from 8 - 10 a.m. at the Slide & 82nd McDonald's location.

Most days we're encouraging you to slow down on the overpasses, but today we have a curve ball for you! The roads under the overpasses that didn't receive much sun yesterday have slick and icy places! Continue to drive with caution and slow down as you're traveling this morning.

Lubbock County has been downgraded to a Winter Weather Advisory until 6 p.m. Up to and additional 2" of snow are still possible. Road conditions are still icy in some areas. Please continue to use caution while driving.
Check out what safety tips @ChiefCaspell has to say for your morning commute! https://bit.ly/2S0WLuq
In the event of low visibility due to snow or slick road conditions, Patrol Officers will drive with their lights on to slow down traffic and prevent crashes.
Lots of information and resources are available! Make sure you're prepared before heading out on the roads this evening and tomorrow.
Agreed! Plus, who wouldn't want to stay nice and cozy at home if you had the option?
Make sure to take care of your furry friends!!

As we prepare for winter weather, many departments will be out on the roads throughout Lubbock. Please make sure to MOVE OVER or SLOW DOWN if you see ANY flashing lights. We need your help to keep Lubbock safe!

Are you prepared for winter weather? Starting at noon TODAY Lubbock will be under a Winter Storm Warning. Make sure to plan ahead by checking out these tips from @NWSLubbock & by signing up for emergency notifications at http://LBKAlert.com

Enjoy today's warm temperatures, because snow is forecasted for Tuesday into Wednesday! We will be under a Winter Storm Watch starting at noon Tuesday. Start planning now to give yourself extra time for travel, and making sure you have any supplies needed during this time period!
Half time is over! Do you know what that means? Only two more quarters to make sure you have a safe & sober ride home! Celebrate responsibly by getting home safely!

On Wednesday, 487 traffic stops were made between all three agencies on the first day of joint enforcement. The top violations observed included speeding and failing to move over or slow down, along with other traffic offenses.
LS is getting geared up for his night out in the Depot District! Him and his best bud, Frisco, will be out there until 8! If you see them, stop by and say hi!

After more than 31 years of service to the Lubbock community, Bureau of Operations Assistant Chief Jerry Brewer retired from the Lubbock Police Department. We sure are going to miss seeing him around but are so excited for what he has planned next!
TODAY at 3 p.m., Assistant Chief Jerry Brewer's retirement is taking place at the Lubbock Police Department! Come on out and help us celebrate his 31 plus years of service!
Do you recognize any of these suspects? If so, please call Crime Line at 741-1000. You can remain anonymous and may even be eligible for a CASH reward! #WantedWednesday

Have you noticed a lot of flashing lights on Marsha Sharp, I-27, and South Loop 289? Our area law enforcement agencies are enforcing safe driving across the city and we're here to remind you to move over or slow down!
Look at sweet Frisco helping Cowboy get big and strong! We appreciate everything our Mounted Patrol does for us!
Heading out to watch the Red Raiders tonight!? Make sure to plan while you can. It’s nothing but net when you find a sober ride home! #TTUbasketball #RedRaiders
*TRAFFIC ALERT* Due to a crash on I-27 near 82nd Street, all southbound lanes of I-27 are closed and traffic is being diverted westbound on Loop 289.
#Trafficalert Traffic crash involving a commercial vehicle and Jeep in westbound lanes of Loop 289 & Slide Rd. Traffic is backed up to Quaker Ave. #slowdown
Do you recognize any of these suspects?! If so, please call Crime Line at 741-1000. You can remain anonymous and may even be eligible for a CASH reward! #WantedWednesday

Are you near the Lubbock Memorial Civic Center? Stop on by and grab yourself a breakfast plate! There is no set price, however, donations are welcomed and all proceeds received will go to the families of first responders Matt Dawson, Eric Hill and Nicholas Reyna.

A new work zone is in place and active on I-27 between 50th Street & 82nd Street. Currently the northbound left lane is closed, and the speed limit is reduced to 55 mph for both north and southbound traffic. Please stay alert, slow down, and keep your eyes on the road.
Roads are being treated, but SLOW DOWN! We expect roadways, especially overpasses, to start freezing and will likely have patchy ice. Treated roads are not meant to be driven at the speed limit.
What an amazing sight to see so many come together. It may have been cold, but the warmth could be felt by all.

A public visitation will be hosted from 7-10 p.m. Thursday at Holy Spirit Catholic Church. Ofc. Reyna’s funeral will be at 11 a.m. Saturday at Trinity Church. Following the funeral, a procession will escort Ofc. Reyna from the church to Resthaven Funeral Home.

Quaker Avenue northbound from Loop 289 until 66th Street will be closed starting at 6 p.m. Quaker Avenue southbound from 66th Street until Loop 289 will remain open as long as possible, but will close to allow foot traffic to cross safely when needed.

Parking will be available in the parking lots in the northeast corner of Quaker Avenue and Loop 289, as well as west of the memorial in lots at the TTUHSC Garrison Institute on Aging and Centennial Bank.

A candlelight memorial will be held to honor Lubbock Police Officer Nicholas Reyna and Lubbock Fire Rescue Lieutenant/Paramedic Eric Hill at 7 p.m. Jan. 15 at the Lubbock Regional Public Safety Memorial, 6601 Quaker Ave.
“Our Boys are home, thank you to everyone across the Great State of Texas. So much respect.” -@Chief_FMitchell

For all those who want to pay their respects, Officer Reyna’s patrol car is parked outside the Lubbock Police Department. We encourage the citizens of Lubbock to bring flowers to tie onto his patrol car to honor and thank him for his service.

Ofc. Nicholas Reyna was transported to Fort Worth this morning. He was escorted through Lubbock County by Lubbock Police officers and numerous members of our first responder family, while our Lubbock community paid their respects.
We’re so thankful for the showing of support from our community and law enforcement family for Ofc. Reyna this morning as he was escorted today.

"I and the #LubbockPolice want to thank everyone, our community, our law enforcement family and our elected officials for the outpouring of support we've received following the death of Ofc. Reyna. Our hearts mourn for our Lubbock First Responder Family." -@Chief_FMitchell
It is not possible to express the hurt we all feel from the death our own officer, and the death and injuries to our firefighter brothers, and the grief of their families and friends.

The injured firefighter who remains in critical condition is 30-year-old Firefighter/Paramedic Matt Dawson. He has been with the department for five years. Matt Dawson is stationed at Fire Station 2A.
39-year-old Lieutenant/Paramedic Eric Hill served with Lubbock Fire Rescue for ten years. Eric had promoted to lieutenant in July 2019 and was stationed at Fire Station 10B.

Today our hearts mourn for the losses and critical injuries experienced by our Lubbock First Responder Family. 27-year-old Officer Nicholas Reyna served with the Lubbock Police Department for one year. Following the academy, he served on patrol during the day shift.
Click the link to see maps of the closures and to check when roadways are re-opened:

ROAD UPDATE (8:10 a.m.): The following roads remain closed: Westbound Marsha Sharp Freeway flyover to West Loop 289 The following roads have been re-opened: Eastbound 4th Street flyover to Marsha Sharp Freeway Eastbound Loop 289 flyover to I-27 northbound
Click the link to see maps of the closures and to check when roadways are re-opened: http://cityoflubbock.maps.arcgis.com/apps/webappviewer/index.html?id=d6dca4199e184d8daa0802c27d3bad1b

UPDATE (4:30 a.m.): Lubbock Police have closed the following roadways due to slick conditions: Westbound Marsha Sharp Freeway flyover to West Loop 289 Eastbound 4th Street flyover to Marsha Sharp Freeway Eastbound Loop 289 flyover to I-27 northbound
UPDATE: Lubbock Police have closed the following roadways due to slick conditions: Westbound Marsha Sharp Freeway flyover to West Loop 289 Eastbound 4th Street flyover to Marsha Sharp Freeway

Lubbock Police are closing the westbound Marsha Sharp Freeway flyover to West Loop 289 due to slick conditions. Do not move or drive around barricades, they are placed for your safety and it is against the law! See the map below to see the exact section of roadway closed.
The temperatures in the city will continue to drop, and roadways are going to slick! Slow down when traveling and stay home if you don't need to get out!
Got flight plans? Check with your airlines before heading to @flyLBB

LPD officers were dispatched to the 1500 block of 25th St. at 6 p.m. reference a disturbance with shots fired. Officers arrived and located one victim who has been pronounced deceased. More info as it becomes available.

Investigators are on scene at a major crash on the eastbound access road of the South Loop at Avenue P. One person has been pronounced deceased. Please avoid the area and give yourself extra travel time.

Wow! Well we sure do feel loved! Thank you so much to everyone who came by and dropped off items, food, and drinks for our LPD family on Law Enforcement Appreciation Day! We love our Lubbock community! #NationalLawEnforcementAppreciationDay #LubbockTX

We have some sad news to share with you today. Earlier this week, retired K9 Jax passed away. He was with the LPD from 2010 to 2014 when he retired due to joint related issues and lived out his days with his handler, Officer Stamps. Thank you for your service, Jax.

LPD Arrests Suspect in 10-month-old Murder (LUBBOCK, TX) – The Metropolitan Special Crimes Unit arrested Trevor Rowe at approximately 1 a.m. Jan. 8 for the murder of 10-month-old Marion Jester-Montoya. Click here for full release: https://bit.ly/2tEQwCY
*TRAFFIC ALERT* Due to a major crash, westbound main lanes of Loop 289 are closed east of N. Quaker. Traffic will be diverted onto the access road. Please expect delays or avoid the area if possible.
The subject fired on the officers and the officers returned fire at 5:55 a.m. The subject was hit and has died.
Update: At 5:37 a.m. officers responded to a call in the 3600 block of 96th Street for an individual attempting to open door handles. The subject fled on foot, and officers pursued him.
LPD Officer involved shooting at 94th and Orlando Ave. No details on injuries just yet. Media staging will be at 93rd and Memphis. PIO is on scene.

It's #NationalTriviaDay, can you guess what year this picture was taken?! The picture features 4 LPD K9s smiling ear to ear at their own "Appreciation Dinner" just before they devoured their individual steaks. They even had their own napkins to wipe their paws with after!

This Friday Favorite is extra special! Our very own LPD H.O.T. Dog, Justice, turned TWO just a few days ago and her owner shared some of her favorite things. Happy belated birthday, Justice! #FridayFavorite
Officers are on scene of a shooting at 3201 South Loop 289. One victim and suspect is outstanding.

The LPD Major Crash Unit is on the scene of a one vehicle rollover at East Loop 289 and 4th Street. The driver and passenger were taken to UMC by EMS with life threatening injuries. Avoid the area please.
LPD Major Crash Unit is investigating a fatal crash at Slide Rd. and MSF. Slide Rd. is closed from 34th St. to north of MSF. Eastbound access road of MSF is also closed. Avoid the area please.
The LPD Major Crash Unit is responding to a fatal crash in the 1900 block of 15th St.
Shooting at Level Nightclub has claimed two lives. Suspect is still outstanding. METRO investigators continue to investigate. More information will be released as it becomes available.
LPD is on the scene of a shooting at Level Nightclub in the 1900 block of Buddy Holly Ave. At least two victims at this time. Suspect is still outstanding. METRO investigators are responding.
Happy New Year! As you're ringing in 2020, make sure to celebrate responsibly!! #NewYear2020

Need some help coming up with some New Year's resolutions? Well we've got you covered... Make sure to celebrate responsibly by keeping these three resolutions in mind while you ring in the New Year!!! #SafetyFirst #NewYear2020
LPD and DPS officers are in pursuit of a reckless driver. Last in the area of 82nd St. and Ave P eastbound. Please use caution if you see red and blue lights.
Avoid US 84 and CR 3600 southeast of Slaton due to a multiple vehicle crash and dense fog!
**UPDATE: Martinez has been located safe!**

Martinez is described as a Hispanic male w/ gray hair, brown eyes, approximately 155 pounds and is 6 feet 2 inches tall. He wears glasses and was last seen wearing a black jacket and blue jeans. Martinez has diminished mental capacities. Anyone who sees Martinez should call 911
Lubbock Police Officers are searching for 68-year-old Michael Martinez, who was last seen around 3 p.m. today near the 3200 block of 59th Street.

At this time, LPD SWAT is releasing the scene at the Howard Johnson back to patrol officers. SWAT was called as a precaution due to a possible barricaded subject. Upon entering the room, no subject was found.
Avoid the area near the Howard Johnson, located at 5108 I-27, due to LPD SWAT responding to a possible barricaded subject.
Due to a major crash at North Frankford and Kent Street, both roads have been closed. Please seek alternate routes.

Due to a major crash at 72nd Street and Quaker Avenue, we are encouraging the public to find alternate routes and to avoid the area. Northbound lanes on Quaker Avenue are closed from 74th Street to 71st Street.

Webb’s family is offering a $2,000 reward for information leading to his current known location. Anyone who sees Webb or has information on his whereabouts should call 911. Those w/ info can also call Investigator Bo Roberts at 806-548-1664 or Detective BD Price 806-548-4111.

Lubbock Police Officers continue searching for a missing man, 40-year-old Dustin Jewell Webb, who was last seen on Nov. 7 near 46th Street and Quaker Avenue. Webb is described as a white male with red hair, blue eyes, approximately 165 pounds and is 6 feet tall.

The FBINA is a professional course of study for U.S. and International law enforcement leaders that serves to improve the administration of justice in police departments and agencies and to raise law enforcement standards, knowledge, and cooperation worldwide.

We're proud to announce Lieutenant Marcus Wall recently graduated from the @FBI National Academy! Lieutenant Wall has been with LPD since February 2005. He currently serves as a Lieutenant in the Patrol Bureau.
LPD Arrests Individual for Aggravated Assault on a Peace Officer View full release here: https://bit.ly/2Q3o2Kv

He's making a list, He's checking it twice... Are you traveling out of town this holiday season? Take some pointers from the jolly man himself and make sure to double check your vehicle before leaving! (At least you don't have to worry about the reindeer...)

This week, the South Plains Police Chiefs Association dropped off stuffed animals for the children over at Covenant Health! We hope that this can help bring some holiday cheer to those who need it the most!
Due to a crash, traffic from the southbound lanes of North I-27 will be diverted off at Regis Street. The frontage road is open but use caution. Please avoid the area if possible.
We had a great time getting a cup of coffee with great members of our #Lubbock community this morning! – at Market Street
HAPPENING NOW! Join us for Coffee with a Cop at Market Street at 50th and Indiana until 11 a.m.! #CoffeeWithACop – at Market Street

Coffee with a Cop is happening, TOMORROW, December 14, at 9 a.m. Make sure to come out to the Starbucks located in Market Street (50th St) from 9 - 11 a.m.!! Grab a friend, some coffee, and chat with LPD. #CoffeeWithACop

Yesterday, the South Plains Police Chiefs Association delivered stuffed animals to children at @umchealthsystem We were thankful to bring just a little holiday cheer to such strong and brave individuals.

LS and Frisco are here to share what they have learned so far from patrolling the parking lot at the mall! -LOCK your vehicle doors -HIDE or REMOVE all valuables that are in your vehicle -Make sure to TAKE your keys!!
If you have any information on this suspect, please call Crime Line at 741-1000 or @TexasTechPD at 806-742-3931.

As we discussed, we reviewed the audio recording of the call, and found the call taker asked about the description of the individual appropriately. You are still welcome to come to the police department to review the call yourself. Please let us know if you would like to.

Coffee with a Cop is happening, Saturday, December 14, at 9 a.m. Make sure to come out to the Starbucks located in Market Street (50th St) from 9 - 11 a.m.!! Grab a friend, some coffee, and chat with LPD. #CoffeeWithACop
Santa!!! We KNOW him!!! This morning, we kicked off the 12th Annual Santa Cops! Thank you to all our sponsors that made this day possible for 25 children! #SantaCops

Seen some strange visitors at the South Plains Mall recently? Don’t be alarmed, that’s just Mounted Patrol in the parking lot to make sure you, your vehicle, and your presents are safe this holiday season! You can tell Frisco takes his job a little more seriously than LS...

Yesterday, @Chief_FMitchell and several LPD officers attended the Special Olympics Breakfast with Champions event! This event was to help raise awareness of @SpecialOlympics programs and to raise funds for athletes. Over $7,900 was raised!!! #FridayFavorite
It only takes 8 seconds... and we ain't talkin' 'bout bullridin' Last year, nearly vehicles were stolen with the keys left inside. Of those, more than were left running and unlocked.
Romo has been located.

#LubbockPolice are asking for the public’s help in locating Leah Renea Romo, 26, who has a warrant for possession of a controlled substance. Romo is described as a Hispanic female w/ red hair, green eyes, approx. 130 pounds & is 5'3" inches tall. Anyone w/ info should call 911.
Durham has been located!

#LubbockPolice Officers are searching for Melba Sue Durham, 68, who was reported missing around 6:45 a.m. Durham was last seen leaving her residence at 5802 Duke Street. She was walking and does not have access to a vehicle. Anyone who sees her should call 911 immediately.

#LubbockPolice are currently searching for a missing man, 40-year-old Dustin Jewell Webb, who was last seen on Nov. 7 near 46th Street & Quaker Avenue. Webb is described as a white male w/ red hair, blue eyes, approximately 165 pounds & is 6 feet tall. Call 911 if you have info.
Who's ready to get their shopping on?! Follow these Black Friday safety tips, and be kind to your fellow shoppers!
#LubbockPolice wishes you a happy and safe Thanksgiving! City offices are closed today, but our best in blue will be out patrolling! #HappyThanksgiving

Temperatures are expected to remain around 32 degrees through the morning and there's a chance of slick spots on roads. As you get out and about this morning, make sure to drive slow and give yourself plenty of time! The turkey can wait a few minutes for you to arrive safely!

Can you help us identify these suspects for #WantedWednesday? Anyone with information is encouraged to call Crime Line at 741-1000. You can remain anonymous and may even be eligible for a CASH reward! #TippinAintSnitchin
Wondering how you can help keep your home safe this #Thanksgiving? Check out a few of these safety tips...
Some helpful tips from our friends over at @LubbockFire !!

BABY UPDATE! Buttermilk's foal has been named Cowboy and he is doing great! Just look how big he has gotten! Make sure to follow Lubbock Police Department Mounted Patrol on Facebook for more updates on this little guy!
Are you traveling for Thanksgiving? We're here to remind you of a few safety tips when it comes to long road trips!
Today we broke ground for our very first substation! “I cannot wait to open the doors of the East Substation and welcome everyone to our home,” said @Chief_FMitchell

Look at this extra sweet surprise from Trinity Christian School. This morning, our officers were thanked for all their hard work with cookies, letters, and a short prayer to help keep them safe in the line of duty. We love our community!
Tomorrow is a VERY exciting day for the LPD... Starting at 2 p.m., the East Substation Groundbreaking will begin! You don't want to miss it! Come on out!!
Due to crash investigations, expect road closures from 9 a.m.-2:15 p.m. at 5200 South Loop 289, 7000 University Ave. & 23rd St. and Ave Q.

.@Chief_FMitchell spoke at tonight’s Community Engagement Task Force Public Forum and discussed the important role of the new police substations in building stronger ties with the #Lubbock community! – at TTU - International Cultural Center

Drum roll please... We’re happy to announce that @Chief_FMitchell is officially sworn in!! On Friday, Mayor Dan Pope publicly swore in Chief with his wife and two sons at his side. The LPD is lucky to have such a strong leader as our new Chief of Police!
Tons of people from across Lubbock came out to meet @Chief_FMitchell this evening at the @LubbockChamber Chief’s Reception!

After competing in the Day 2 events, LPD SWAT has now moved up to th place overall at SWAT Round-Up International! Our very own, Kolton Pirkle, also received FIRST PLACE , out of 74 competitors, in the individual Firearms Challenge event!

Yesterday was LPD SWAT’s first day at SWAT Round-Up International and they are sitting at number out of teams across the WORLD! They still have more events over the next few days...so help us cheer them on as they compete against some of the best around the globe!
The Lubbock Police Department would like to thank all of the military veterans who have selflessly served and protected this great nation of ours. Today we honor you! #VeteransDay
Please avoid the area of 82nd and Slide due to a traffic accident.

We are looking for two suspects in connection to an aggravated robbery/aggravated kidnapping. Anyone who sees the suspects or has information on their whereabouts should call 911. People may also use Crime Line at 806-741-1000. Crime Line callers can remain anonymous.
On Friday, November 15, 2019, the City of Lubbock will host a Swearing-In Ceremony for new Lubbock Police @Chief_FMitchell Everyone is invited, so come on out!!

With dropping temperatures and a chance of freezing drizzle and fog, make sure to SLOW DOWN when driving tonight and tomorrow morning! Take it Slow Put Away All Distractions ..... Increase Distance Between Vehicles Accelerate and Decelerate Slowly

It's time for a #WantedWednesday!! Can you help us identify these suspects? Anyone with information is encouraged to call Crime Line at 741-1000. You can remain anonymous and may be eligible for a CASH reward!

Lubbock Police are proud to support the “Can You See Me” campaign! With the eyes of our community we can rescue more victims of human trafficking and put the responsible criminals in jail. If you suspect it, report it! #TexasSeesYou

The officer also had a green light, when a red Camaro crossed in front of the officer and the cars collided. We value the public's trust in our work, and we take that trust very seriously. We hope this dash-camera footage clears up any confusion on the occurrences that evening.

On that evening, an officer observed a traffic violation on University Avenue that occurred behind an ambulance. Both vehicles were traveling northbound on University. The officer was attempting to catch up to the individual to make a stop with both his sirens and lights enabled.
For the sake of transparency and the relationship we have with the Lubbock community, we are releasing the dash-camera footage from an officer-involved crash that occurred Nov. 3rd. [See Thread]

Members of the Homeless Outreach Team, @BergenLPD, Ofc. Chacon, Ofc. Trotter and Justice, were recognized w/ the Louise Cummins Outstanding Organization award by @VolunteerLBK today for their work helping homeless people get back on their feet by connecting them to resources! – at Lubbock Memorial Civic Center
Corporal Chris Paine is giving tips for how you can protect yourself and information officers need during active attacks. Tune into @fox34’s Look Around Lubbock to find out more. – at Star ER
Don't forget to come on out and help us congratulate our 2019A graduates at the Graduation, Retirement and Award Ceremony today at 3 p.m!
Don't be a jerk-o-lantern this Halloween! Follow these safety tips to help you have a fang-tastic night! #HappyHallowen
SWAT Stand-off from 2100 65th is over. Police presence will remain for some time longer but area is safe.
LPD SWAT is in a stand-off in the 2100 block of 65th St. LPD PIO is on scene. Media staging is in the 6500 block of Ave U. We’re asking the public to avoid the area.
All barricades have been opened! Please continue to use caution while driving.
Make sure to stay alert and pay attention while driving.
-All of Marsha Sharp Freeway westbound and eastbound are open -All of Loop 289 is open -I27 at 84th and 19th Street westbound flyover are open
-All of South Loop westbound from I27 to West Loop at 19th are open -All of Marsha Sharp Freeway is open except for flyovers
As we are reopening, please maintain slower safer speeds. Do not breach barricades still in place.
-South Loop at I27 eastbound, northbound flyover remains CLOSED
Open barricades: -3000 West Loop -19th between Quaker and Memphis -2000 South Loop eastbound -4800 West Loop -5300 South Loop -700 Marsha Sharp -4600 to 5000 South Loop
The barricade map will begin to show open barricades in green stars. Click here to view: https://bit.ly/36gS4Sl
*Reminder* You can find an interactive map with live updates of barricaded roadways here: http://bit.ly/2Wqv8eK
1. Slow down and pay attention 2. Don't move the barricades 3. Arrive SAFELY to your location

It is against the law to move barricades. They are placed for not only your safety, but the safety of those around you. Flat surfaces are not as icy but elevated roadways are (bridges and overpasses).
Please do NOT move the barricades that are put in place for your safety! Your morning commute might be longer due to road closures but at least you will be safe!
Several areas around Lubbock are shut down due to hazardous driving conditions this morning. You can find an interactive map with live updates of barricaded roadways here: https://bit.ly/2Wqv8eK
-South Loop and University westbound -West Loop and Marsha Sharp Fwy northbound

-34th and West Loop -5200 Marsha Sharp eastbound -I27 and Marsha Sharp westbound -Slide and Marsha Sharp westbound -4900 West Loop northbound -19th and Marsha Sharp eastbound flyover -Slide and South Loop eastbound -South Loop and Indiana westbound
Due to icy roads, there are several locations shut down for your safety. Please expect delays and drive slow this morning!
If you have to be out on the roads, make sure to take it slow and stay alert!
We’re very proud of Officer Thompson for being recognized by @POTUS today at @TheIACP!

We’re proud of Lubbock Police Officer Thomas Thompson for his recognition as 1 of 4 finalists for the 2019 @TheIACP /@Target Police Officer of the Year Award! This prestigious award recognizes outstanding achievement in law enforcement. Join us in congratulating Officer Thompson!
With the temperatures dropping, prepare for possible slick & icy roads. The City has Public Works crews out now until the morning.
Check it out! One of our officers with the Mustang Unit accepted the #TetrisChallenge! Look at all the gear they carry around!
The City Council voted 6-0 in favor of @Chief_FMitchell being named the new chief of police! – at Lubbock City Hall
It’s an exciting day for LPD as the @cityoflubbock City Council prepares to vote on the appointment of Floyd Mitchell as the new chief of police! We’ll be starting momentarily!

Happy Monday! We would like to invite you to come to the Lubbock Police Academy Graduation, Retirement, and Award Ceremony. Help us recognize all these men and women (and one K9) for their hard work and dedication to the City of Lubbock on November 1 at 3 p.m.!

11:00 a.m. – 1:00 p.m. - - 3800 University Avenue – North bound lanes will be closed first and keep the south bound lanes open. The north bound lanes will divert east on 39th Street and the south bound lanes will be diverted west on 37th Street.
9:45 a.m. – 11:00 a.m. – 4500 Quaker Avenue – The north and south bound lanes will be temporarily blocked off. South bound lanes will be diverted west to 44th Street.

Please expect road closures and delays due to crash investigations. Until 9:30 a.m. - 8800 University Ave – The north and south bound lanes will be temporarily blocked off. All south bound lanes of travel will be diverted west onto 86th Street.

DRUM ROLL PLEASE... @akcdoglovers recently named K9 Max as the recipient of the 2019 Paw of Courage award. This award recognizes working canines that put their lives on the line every day to keep our communities safe. Help us congratulate our sweet and very brave K9!
We enjoyed attending the @LBKUnitedWay Mid-Campaign Report today. By rising together, over $3,637,000 has been raised to date! #LiveUnitedLBK
Subject is now in custody and unharmed. #welldone
We are now stopped at 82nd and I-27. Subject has fired a weapon. Please stay away from the area! Very volatile situation!
Officers were in pursuit and are now in a stand-off with the driver near 2200 96th. Please avoid the area.

*LPD Searching for Missing Woman* (LUBBOCK, TX) – The Lubbock Police Department is continuing to search for missing 38-year-old Vicki Gray who was last seen and heard from on June 6, 2019. (Click here for full release: https://bit.ly/2Yqu2TG)
passed their physical exam and will continue on to background checks!
Check out this morning’s entrance examination process numbers: signed up sat for the written exam participated in the physical exam

Don't forget to send that application in by 5 p.m. TODAY! Apply to become a probationary police officer! We are looking for candidates interested in making a difference in our community! The deadline to apply is TODAY, October 11th. The exam will be held on Saturday, October 12th
We love seeing so many people come out to the First Responder Job Fair! And it's not too late to find out more! The fair continues until 2 p.m. today at the Science Spectrum!

Our LPD Mounted Patrol has a BIG announcement...drum roll, please... Buttermilk is officially on maternity leave and she has her hooves full with a healthy baby boy! He was born at 12:20 a.m. today! Comment below what you think we should name this strong little guy!
Congratulations, Chief Mitchell! Please help us welcome our new Chief!
Come on out to the Science Spectrum located at 2579 South Loop 289 on Thursday, October 10th from 10 a.m. to 2 p.m. and learn all about what it takes to be a First Responder!

Come on out tomorrow to the Meet the Recruiter Night! This is a come and go event between 5:30 p.m. and 7 p.m.! If you've ever been interested in joining our team, this is the perfect time to get some information!

We're seeing some issues w/ flooding & are responding to a few areas where drivers have stalled out due to high water. Underpass @Broadway/I-27 is also being blocked off due to high water. DO NOT attempt to drive in areas w/ standing water. It can be hard to tell how deep it is
Heavy rain across Lubbock... that means we could see flash flooding in areas across Lubbock. DO NOT try to drive through high water.
Keep in mind, when we get a lot of rain very quickly we could see flash flooding, especially in low lying areas. The NWS has issued a Flash Flood Warning for Lubbock until 9 p.m.
The Severe Thunderstorm Warning has been extended until 7:45 p.m.

Lubbock is under a Severe Thunderstorm Warning until 7:15 p.m. There are already reports of pea to marble sized hail in some parts of Lubbock. Please be careful if you're out and about. If you can, stay indoors until the storm passes.
Lubbock has been included in a Tornado Watch until 10 P.M. Make sure that you are prepared and sign up for emergency notifications at http://LBKAlert.com

*TRAFFIC ALERT* at 1 pm the 3100 block of Marsha Sharp will be shut down. Eastbound traffic will be forced to exit at the University exit. Drivers can get back on Marsha Sharp before Ave Q. This is for eastbound lanes only. Closure will last approx 1.5 hours.

THIS MORNING at 9a.m. the intersection of Slide & 19th Street will be shut down so detectives can continue a crash investigation. One lane in each direction will remain open. Please be careful in the area and look out for officers directing traffic. Closure may last about 2 hours
This morning we met up with several other agencies to honor fallen first responders across the #SouthPlains. Thank you to everyone who came out and gave their support!
Priscilla Martinez, 39, is now charged w/ failure to stop & render aid in connection to the fatal hit & run crash in the 2700 block of Ave Q that killed Gloria Valdez on May 14th.

HAPPENING TODAY! At 10am several law enforcement agencies will get together for the Lubbock Regional Peace Officers Memorial! Community members are welcome to come out to help us honor our local fallen first responders killed in the line of duty.
The Emergency Operations Center (EOC) is returning to Level IV, Normal Conditions. The immediate threat for the city of Lubbock has passed at this time.
10 P.M. UPDATE: The Tornado Watch for Lubbock County has been canceled. We are monitoring one more storm that might affect Lubbock but will have an update within the hour.

The #TornadoWatch for Lubbock and surrounding counties has been extended to 10 P.M. Make sure to have a plan in place and sign up for #LBKAlerts at http://LBKAlert.com to receive emergency notifications. We will continue to keep you updated!

**DRIVE WITH CAUTION** Due to the #SevereWeather we are experiencing several traffic signal outages across town. As you approach an intersection that is flashing red or has no lights at all, make sure to treat it as a 4-way stop! Stay alert and drive with caution.

We're currently under a severe thunderstorm watch until 10 am. It looks like we could start seeing storms around 4am-5am timeframe. Please keep an eye on the weather before heading out this morning. We'll continue to monitor the storms & keep you updated on what we're seeing.

We'll be keeping a close eye on these severe storms that could bring large hail, high wind gusts & the potential for tornadoes. These storms are expected to begin around 3am tomorrow. If you haven't already, you can sign up for emergency notifications at http://LbkAlert.com

That's a wrap folks! The results are in! Out of 133 who showed up for the entrance exam, 83 passed both thr written and physical portions of the test! Congratulations to those men and women who are moving on with the rest of the hiring process!

Out of the 133 who took the written test this morning, 103 passed the written phase! Those men and women are now in the process of taking the physical agility portion of the entrance exam. Good luck applicants!

It is test day!!! We had 133 people show up to the academy to take the entrance exam to become a police officer. First up is the written portion of the test. If they pass that test they will move on to the physical agility test. Please help us wish them good luck!

#TexasAntiGang (TAG) investigators arrest Nathaniel Tyson, 41, for aggravated assault for the March 11th shooting that sent 1 person to the hospital w/ moderate injuries. During his arrest, investigators also found meth & several guns including some that were reported stolen.

Here's a #MondayMotivation coming your way! Always strive to make a difference in the lives around you. You never know who might be watching or how it might impact those around you.... even if it's something as simple playing hoops with the neighborhood kids.

Drinking green beer this weekend for St. Patrick's Day? Alcohol can slow your reaction time & your vision could be Dublin behind the wheel. It's not a game of luck. If you drive drunk this St. Patrick's day you could end up in our paddy wagon spending a pot of gold on DWI fines.
All eastbound lanes of the access road are back open. Crash investigation is ongoing.

All eastbound lanes of N. Loop 289 access rd. at N. Slide Rd are shut down due to a crash b/t pickup truck & pedestrian. Pedestrian taken to the hospital w/ life threatening injuries. All EB traffic on access rd must turn on N. Slide. Closure is expected to last several hours.

With yesterday's crazy wind, we're just now getting around to posting our #WantedWednesday video and boy is it clear! Good for us, not so good for these suspects. Call #CrimeLine at 806-741-1000 if you have any info. You could be eligible for a cash reward!
It looks like the worst of the winds are over. BUT, continue be alert and watch out for potential road hazards.

City officials are giving updates on what we've seen around town. We anticipate peak wind gusts up to 70mph to hit between 4-6pm. Please continue to drive w/ caution & be on the lookout for debris & objects blown into the roadway. Also be mindful of possible traffic signals out.

These are some serious wind gusts. Please be careful if you're out today. We continue to see safety concerns with dangerous road hazards such as traffic signal outages, stop signs blown over, multiple uprooted trees and downed power lines.

Reports of power lines down at 916 42nd, 84th & Slide, 42nd & I-27, 200 N Ave P. We also have reports of stop signs blown over near 34th/Inler & 114th/ Ave P. *PLEASE BE CAREFUL & ATTENTIVE WHEN DRIVING*

Lubbock, we know you're used to wind... but please pay attention to this warning! 65 mph gusts are no joke! Make sure your patio furniture and gates are secured (don't want those precious pups sneaking out because a gate blew open).
Help out our friends over at @LubbockFire today. We could see dangerous winds today which means a higher potential for fires. Avoid any outdoor burning.

After a long day of testing, we've finally wrapped up! Of the 97 who advanced to the physical agility test, 78 people passed. Those men & women will now go to the background phase. Congratulations to those who are one step closer to becoming a Lubbock Police Officer!
The written test is done! We now have 97 people who will be moving on to the physical agility portion of the test. Good job and good luck to those who advanced to the next phase!
TEST DAY IS HERE! We had 129 people - several from out of state- show up this morning to take the written portion of the test to become a Lubbock Police Officer! Please help us wish them good luck!

***TESTING INFORMATION*** Application deadline has passed. Testing will take place tomorrow morning. When: Applicants must arrive by 8:30 a.m. Where: Lubbock Memorial Civic Center (1501 Mac Davis Ln.) What: Picture ID needed Please leave valuables (including phones) at home
Look at all of this medicine! We sure do appreciate the community’s cooperation! We’re here until 3, so come on out to 22nd and Joliet!
It’s turning into a community event out here, which we LOVE! So, come on down, turn in your expired, unused, or unwanted medication and then get some lunch! We’re at 22nd and Joliet!
WE’RE HERE at Lubbock Spine Institute collecting prescriptions so you don’t have to get rid of them! On top of that, lunch is being served, so come on down!
Glad our officers were able to help out!

Every year we see several DEADLY drunk driving crashes in Lubbock. Help us out in 2019 & drink responsibly. These crashes are the result of selfish choices & are 100% preventable. Be smart & plan ahead. Don't be the person who thinks "It won't happen to me". Why risk it?
We want you to see 2019. Don't drive drunk.

Brrrrr! It's going to be a cold few days! We hope you stay bundled up as you ring in the New Year! Also, we could see some hazardous driving conditions with a chance of freezing drizzle starting tomorrow night.

New year, new you? Looking for a change? We've got you covered! We're looking for people who want to make a difference in our community. The next #LubbockPolice Academy test date is January 12th. Applications due Jan. 11th. Apply here: http://www.lubbockpolice.com #ProtectTheHub

We cannot stress this enough! PLAN AHEAD. Many people THINK they are okay to drive, they're just a little buzzed... alcohol impairs your judgement. Make plans to have a sober driver - Uber, Lyft, a taxi, friend or family member - BEFORE the alcohol impacts your choices.

PEOPLE - PETS - PLANTS - PIPES! We will see another cold spell as we head in the New Year. Make sure to check on elderly neighbors or family members to make sure they have heat. Bring in your pets and plants, and cover exposed pipes to prevent freezing.
UPDATE on deaths of married couple last night in the 4700 block of 29th Street. The joint LPD & LSO Metro Special Crimes Unit is investigating. Click photo for full press release:

Plan on ringing in the New Year with a few drinks? Plan ahead and designate a driver: a friend, family member, Uber, Lyft, Taxi ... You have choices. Be responsible and kick off 2019 the right way. #DrunkDrivingKills

We're wishing you & yours a safe & happy holiday!
Nelly with Mounted Patrol knows exactly what the holiday season is all about!
No one likes a Grinch! So, follow these two simple rules & we think you'll have an enjoyable holiday season!
We don't want you to spend your Christmas holiday behind bars. So, plan ahead and designate a sober driver!

Dr. Young is such a valuable part of our team & continues to help lead our officers when it comes to handling calls involving mental health issues. From negotiators to victim services to our newly created crisis intervention team, Dr. Young does it all!

Head's up, the last city council meeting of the year is happening TODAY! Feel free to stop by to either works session, open session....or BOTH!
The area of 2200 Avenue E (northbound I-27 access road between 22nd & 23rd) is back open after this morning's crash. Thank you for your patience as our officers worked the scene.

With Christmas party season in full swing, be sure and find a DD to get you where you're going, safely! There are plenty of options for you to use, like Uber & Lyft, as well as the classic Taxi...there's no reason for anyone to drink & drive!

Our officers have cleared the scene of the wrecks on both west loop 289, and 34th street and the access road of the loop. We appreciate your cooperation and patience!

Right now we're asking people to avoid the area of 50th & Utica where there are downed power lines. @LubbockFire is on scene & @lpandl crews are working to fix damaged equipment!

There have been multiple bomb threats made across the country. We've gotten several here. The threats are made through email & demand payment with Bitcoin. Right now the threats do not appear to be credible; however LPD takes these types of threats seriously. More info below:
Here's a behind the scenes look at the EOC (Emergency Operations Center) these folks are working hard to share information & address any problems that could blow in with this wind!

Thank you so much @cityoflubbock Public Works for working so hard today - we sure do appreciate it!

Tumbleweed Alert These things will be all over LBK today. If you have any loose outdoor Christmas decorations make sure those stay secure. We don't want Santa & his reindeer taking off across town. Also, you know the drill. Secure those trampolines. #WindWarning

TRAFFIC SIGNAL UPDATE: It looks like the signals are working again at Marsha Sharp & W. Loop. However, we could still see issues with traffic signal outages today due to wind. Please pay attention & stay alert, especially @intersections. Call 311 to report traffic signal outages

*TRAFFIC ALERT* We currently have officers directing traffic at the intersection of Marsha Sharp & West Loop. All traffic signals at that intersection are out. We could see more of these outages as the wind continues to get worse. Please drive carefully at intersections.
We know you're used to the wind in LBK... but today it could get nasty. We're already seeing 30 to 40 mph gusts and some light rain. Be carful as you head out this morning.

With this next round of winter weather heading our way, the biggest concern is WIND - so be sure to secure all of your outdoor X-mas decorations! There is also a concern for blowing snow & dust w/low visibility, so be mindful when you head out in the morning!
We are honored to invite the public to our next Promotions, Awards & Retirement Ceremony, taking place one week from today. We hope to see you there!

Holy, moly....that's a lot of snow! We appreciate everyone's patience & cooperation during this winter weather event as we continue to work to keep everyone safe!

Here's a quick message from @LBKChief as you head out on your morning commute! Marsha Sharp and the Loop are back open, but please stay alert for icy patches. Be very careful on overpasses and bridges.

Expect patchy freezing fog and icy spots on the roads this morning. LEAVE EARLY and give yourself plenty of time for your morning commute. We anticipate Marsha Sharp and the Loop to be reopened. But take it slow & stay alert especially on bridges and overpasses.
Heads up from our friends over at @LubbockFire
We anticipate icy conditions. Take it slow and easy and give yourself plenty of time to get to work. It's unclear when these roads will be reopened.

Here's a look at some of our intersections. 82nd/Indiana & 50th/Quaker still has some snow/ice/slush but are drivable. The majority of city intersections look more like 50th & Indiana. If you have to get out, please take it slow and stay alert for possible icy patches.

As people begin to rise & shine this morning, don't forget we're still under a freezing fog advisory until 10:00 a.m. which means travel is highly discouraged before then! So, be sure & double check to see if your church service was postponed, or cancelled due to the weather!
We have some INCREDIBLE people with AMAZING talent who work with the city. Check out this awesome tool designed to help you!

Right now we are asking citizens to stay off of MSF, I-27 & Loop 289 until further notice! This is because of the black ice and freezing fog. Right now first responders are working about 20 wrecks due to these dangerous conditions.

This is not a drill and definitely not a joke! These conditions put you at risk if you chose to drive in them. Not only you, but some incredible first responders, too @LubbockFire. Please remember that before you get out on the road.
Only when it's very, very official...
Alright, y'all. we mean this in the nicest of ways...STAY OFF THE ROADS! Seriously, freezing fog is moving into the area and that will only increase the risk & danger when it comes to driving.
Right now we have a total of 17 wrecks in city limits, Areas of concern are overpasses, the Loop & Marsha Sharp Fwy. Please steer clear of those areas and head home!

More udpates: slide and the north loop is becoming an area of concern for first responders....if you aren't already home, please try to get there as safely as possible & once you're there, please stay!
Thanks so much, we will sure try! Stay warm!
Ok everyone, as night begins to set in - please be mindful of BLACK ICE! This is a serious concern as the snow which has melted will refreeze overnight.
Folks, we've got our first report of icy concern...it looks like we need to start asking people to avoid north quaker and the north loop!

Alright, lets talk black ice. We expect melted snow to refreeze tonight when the temps drop. That means icy roads and patches of black ice. It can be extremely dangerous. Stay home if you can. If you can't, stay alert & drive slow.
The flyover at South Loop 289 to north I-27 has been reopened. Please continue to take it slow as there may be some icy patches in areas.
Thanks, Austin! We're doing our best to keep everyone updated!
Jean, there is the possiblity we will see slick roads again because the melted snow will refreeze. We'll continue to monitor the roads to keep you updated!

Here's a quick look at some current intersections. Roads are improving, but we are still seeing slick spots so keep it slow. We could also see some of that melted snow start to freeze again.
UPDATE ON CITIBUS ROUTES:

It's still slick out there, folks. The good news is we've had fewer than a dozen crashes since midnight. Usually that number is much higher. However, we have responded to numerous motorists needing assistance. Stay off the roads this morning if you can.

The Lubbock Police Departments Auto Auction scheduled for today is cancelled due to weather. The Auction will be postponed until next Saturday, December 15th. Please stay warm and drive safe.

Quick update from @NWSLubbock If you don't have to - don't get out. Expect slick spots on bridges, overpasses & major roads. @cityoflubbock has multiple trucks treating & clearing major streets & intersections. TxDOT is working on Marsha Sharp, I-27 & the Loop.
In case you were planning on heading out this morning (though we hope you weren't) here's a list of some closures due to the winter weather!

So glad you made it home safely! But yes, you're absolutely right....there's no need to get out in this unless it's completely necessary!

Alright, alright, alright - if you've stuck with us through the night & into these early morning hours, then you know we've been tweeting individual areas to look out for if you HAVE to get on the roads. But, if you'd like to see the full list - head over to our FB page!
We've got another area to watch out for! The flyover on the Marsha Sharp Freeway from 4th street, you'll want to steer clear of that!
And the snow is only going to continue for the foreseeable future! So, our best advice is to hunker down, stay warm & stay safe!
The reports are still coming in! Right now we're getting reports of icy conditions on 19th street from Memphis to Quaker - so if this is an absolute travel must, take it slow & steady!

Just a head's up, reports about roads are still coming in! right now, we're getting reports that conditions are especially bad in the are of 5700 Spur 327 & Loop 289 in Central Lbk. Be mindful if you're absolutely having to drive in that area!
Just because we're seeing the early morning hours doesn't mean city employees aren't working hard to keep citizens safe!
We're hearing reports of especially slick road conditions on 4th street from Detroit to Quaker. If you're not already home, we suggest you head that way - & if you are, please stay there!

Right now we're receiving multiple reports that the south bound lanes on the overpass at I-27 & municipal dr. are getting icy....please stay home if at all possible! If you absolutely HAVE to get out - be sure & avoid the area
So glad you made it, Doug! That's definitely disappointing, especially since our officers are working a wreck right now - and have no desire to work anymore!

Right now we're on the scene of an accident at 82nd & University. If you are out, please avoid the area! It looks like this intersection could be closed for a little bit of time. We'll keep you updated on when officers are able to re-open it #drivesafely #slowdown
Glad we can help out! Drive safely!
We're getting reports of slick overpasses heading northbound on I-27. Please be mindful if you're traveling in that area and be extra cautious!
It looks the area of Frankford from 4th Street to the Loop is a little icy. Be careful if you're in that area.

If you're getting out tonight, please keep an eye on the road conditons. We could see some ice/snow late this evening. Take it SLOW & give yourself extra time to get to your destination. Your stopping distance increases in slick/icy conditions. #StayAlert on bridges & overpasses
Doug, it's possible that we will start to see freezing rain starting around 8pm to 10pm. So be careful when you head to work tonight!

We'll be tracking this storm to give you updates. Please check the weather before heading out tonight or in the morning. There's still a chance for icy/snowy conditions. Remember, increase your following distance in icy conditions and take it slow.

Good morning, folks! We're up bright & early monitoring the roads. It looks like your morning commute should be smooth. While we got a little rain, it doesn't look like any ice on the roadways. BUT stay alert, especially on bridges & overpasses that tend to freeze.
Thanks so much @cityoflubbock for working to keep our roads safe!
Make sure you keep an eye on the weather as we head into the weekend! We could possibly see some icy conditions. The key is to take it SLOW.
Crash at 66th Street and Indiana Ave. Several southbound and eastbound lanes are blocked. No injuries reported.

Big shoutout to our partners over at the U.S. Marshals Service. They arrested 28-yr-old Samuel York Jr this morning. York was wanted for aggravated assault in connection to the Nov. 11th shooting at the Hitching Post. One person had serious but non-life threating injuries.

From our family, to yours. We hope you have a safe and happy holiday!

The Medical Examiner's Office has confirmed the human remains found in a Lubbock backyard during a search on November 16th has been positively identified as Zoe Campos who was reported missing in November of 2013.

Lock all doors & windows, don't advertise on social media that you will be gone, have a trusted friend or neighbor look after your home, & if you're planning a long drive get plenty of sleep and put down the distractions. Be safe as you travel to your Thanksgiving destinations!
But really... don't be that person. If you're enjoying some cold ones this Thanksgiving, put the keys down and let someone else do the driving.

In Nov & Dec we see a spike in package thefts as ppl do their holiday shopping online. We encourage online shoppers to have the packages delivered to a place where someone can receive the delivery in person or opt to have it shipped to the store for pick up.

Good morning! We don't have a designated place; however, our community members are more than welcome to make their transaction @LPD (916 Texas Ave) Our front desk is manned 24/7. And if someone is hesitant to make the trade at LPD... you may want to rethink meeting up with them

LPD Crash Investigators are on scene of a 5 vehicle crash on Quaker Ave. just inside South Loop 289. One person has been taken to the hospital with serious injuries. SB lanes of Quaker just north of the Loop are currently shut down. Please avoid the area.

Here's a #MondayMotivation to start your week! Last Fri about 25 LPD officers attended the TTU Mental Health Law Symposium. Our officers constantly strive to learn more about mental health issues & how to better serve those in our community, especially those w/ mental illness.

25-year-old Carlos Rodriquez is now charged with murder in connection to the 2013 disappearance of Zoe Campos. Rodriquez was already in the Lubbock County Detention Center for unrelated charges. We will continue to provide updates on this case as they become available.

LPD investigators have uncovered remains confirmed as human by the ME's Office in a backyard in the 1900 block of 70th St during a search in connection to the Zoe Campos investigation. However, the remains have not been identified at this time.
Thanks @TxDOTLubbock for all you do! We enjoyed getting to see the kiddos this morning!

After 6 yrs of service to the LBK Community, K9 Bruno is hanging up his work collar. We hate to see him go, but we're happy he will enjoy his retirement at home w/ his handler Cpl Braden! Bruno was a narcotics detection K9 & conducted 110 searches! Happy Retirement, Bruno!

July is Theft Prevention Month. In 2017, there were about 450 vehicles stolen in Lubbock where the keys were left inside the vehicle or it was left running. We tend to see a spike during the summer months. Don't become an easy target! Lock your doors & remove all valuables.

That's fine with us! We're talking about outdoor security cameras & we don't have access to them. If a crime happens near someone registered, we ask if their cameras caught anything & the homeowners/businesses can then VOLUNTARILY give us the video to assist w/ the investigation

SafeCam is our latest investigative & crime fighting tool! Businesses & residents can register their cameras w/ LPD- we can't see any video unless it's given to us.This program could help identify suspects more quickly and prevent more crimes. More info: https://ci.lubbock.tx.us/departments/police-department/about-us

The citizens academy is going out with a bang! For their last class, they're getting a little taste of the National Association of Professional Drivers course that our officers go through. It allows them to test their limits & the vehicle's limits in a controlled environment.
We will pass this along to our traffic enforcement unit.

The 4th & final suspect in the June 5th drive-by shooting that injured a 16-year-old female is behind bars. Today 19-year-old Sabastian Mitchell turned himself in to LSO. He had an outstanding arrest warrant for aggravated assault in connection to the shooting.
#humidity in Lubbock....now that's not something you hear every day....
Thank you so much @cityoflubbock for highlighting this! Our officers enjoy getting out & about and getting to know members of our community!

Rounding out our #LPDFathers tribute is this father-son K9 duo! Pat Nesbitt passed away as a LPD Capt. His son Kody later joined LPD & took after his father as a K9 officer. He even named his K9 Hiko just like his dad's! You can see Kody with both Hikos in these photos!

How sweet is this?! As we honor our #LPDFathers, we can't help but smile at that old photo of Ret. LPD Corporal Bobby Price & his 3-year-old son & future LPD Detective, Brandon Price! What a special bond of sharing the badge! Thank you, Det. Price for following in his footsteps.

Continuing our tribute to #LPDFathers, check out these three! Not only did Ret. LPD Lt. Mike Steen live & breathe community service, but he was such a role model that TWO of his sons followed in his footsteps to become LPD Officers! Happy Father's Day to all three!

As we continue recognizing our #LPDFathers, take a look at these special photos! We want to thank Ret. LPD Sgt. Roy Pierce for passing on his passion of service to his daughter, LPD Officer Jennifer Pierce. #HappyFathersDay

As we continue honoring our #LPDFathers, We would like to give a shoutout to this duo! LPD Sgt.Jason Lewis & son, LPD Officer Bryson Lewis are both currently serving! Happy Father's Day Sgt. Lewis & thank you Ofc. Lewis for following in his footsteps!

Throughout the day we will be honoring some of our LPD Officers who inspired their children to follow in their footsteps! Happy Father's Day Ret.Captain Ricky Cross. Thank you for serving our community & raising your son, Sgt. Brady Cross, to continue that service! #LPDFathers

Talk about following in your father's footsteps! As we continue honoring our #LPDFathers, Officer Kolton Pirkle not only became a LPD officer like his father Sgt. Pirkle, but he also joined the LPD SWAT team too! They're the only father-son duo in LPD SWAT! #HappyFathersDay Sgt!
Hey, @TTU_Baseball, WRECK 'EM! Our officers will be cheering you on tomorrow during your first College World Series game! Make us proud! #GunsUp #WreckEm #TexasTech #LubbockPolice #RaiderPower

We'd like to take a minute to recognize this very special day in our country's history. Today, in 1777, is the day the Second Continental Congress passed a resolution to adopt the flag of the United States of America! #oldglory #starspangledbanner

LPD Detectives made a 3rd arrest in connection to the June 5th drive-by shooting at 37th St. & Ave. U. An arrest warrant for aggravated assault was served today for 17-yr-old Malachi Peppers who has been at the Lubbock County Detention Center since June 7th for unrelated charges

We want to give a HUGE shoutout to everyone who gave it their all during Saturday's LPD Test! 151 took the written exam, 110 advanced to the physical agility test, & 82 people passed both! Those candidates will now go through the background phase.
Don't forget, it's going to be a hot one today! So, be careful if you're going to be out & about. Don't forget to hydrate & put on plenty of sunscreen!

The results are in! Out of 151 who took the written exam, 110 passed & will head out to the LPD academy for the physical agility test! Below are the top scores! Congrats to all of those who passed, & for those who didn't- DON'T GIVE UP. we hope to see you again at the next test!

Today is the day! There are 151 people taking the test to become a #LubbockPoliceOfficer! First up, they have 2.5 hours to complete a written exam. Those who pass will go to the next phase, a physical agility test. Please help us wish them luck!
It's pretty hot outside! Even Justice is working to find ways to cool off!

**ARRESTED** 18-yr-old Deangiilo Hill & 17-yr-old Treveon Tyler are in custody & charged w/ Agg Assault in connection to the drive-by shooting on 37th St. that injured a 16-yr-old female. Their arrests were a team effort by LPD detectives, LSO & the Lubbock Texas Anti-Gang Center

This week will be a doozy! Please remember it's illegal to leave young children unattended in a vehicle. It only takes SECONDS for it to become dangerously hot inside a vehcle in these temps. Also, leaving your vehicle running w/ the keys inside makes it a target for theives

Reminder, City offices are closed tomorrow for Memorial Day. We hope you're enjoying the Memorial Day weekend responsibly... & please remember the real reason behind Memorial Day - to honor & remember those who gave the ultimate sacrifice while serving our country.

Part 1 of our #FridayFavorite! We want to wish Captain Scott Hudgens a happy retirement! After 31 years of service to the Lubbock Police Department, we hate to see him go but we're so thankful he chose LPD as his career! He will truly be missed! Enjoy retirement, Captain!

If you're heading to Lake Alan Henry this weekend, please remember there is a burn ban & our LPD Boat Patrols will be strictly enforcing the ban! This means no fire pits at the campsites. If you're grilling, you must have a lid. Please help us out this weekend!

James, If you're having neighborhood issues, please give us a call and let us know. We pass along those issues to our Captains & patrol. You can even set up a meeting with the officers who cover your neighborhood so they can hear your concerns.
You are absolutely right. It does not. However, ranking our stats to other cities does give a misleading picture.

I hope I've answered some of your questions/statements. We would encourage you to sign up for our Citizens Academy. It gives our community members an in depth look at how we operate, what we investigate and how we spread resources to cover the city and crime we see in Lubbock
Speeding is the number one cause of traffic crashes in Lubbock.

You are actually more likely to be involved in a traffic crash than become a victim of a violent crime in Lubbock. We have units to cover all aspects of crime - including enforcing traffic laws to try & create safer driving conditions for people in Lubbock.
As mentioned in the other tweet, we have a unit dedicated to that. Just like we have a unit dedicated to property crimes, person crimes, and traffic enforcement.
We have an entire Special Operations Unit dedicated to things like dangerous drugs, sex trafficking, prostitution, gang violence and other issues.
Actually, the FBI does NOT rank the cities & specifically says it shouldn't be done b/c it leads to misleading perceptions. However, media continues to do it. This is straight from the FBI site:

Looking @your call info, that was the issue. When a person calls 911 it can take approx. 30 seconds for it to connect to the right 911 call center. While you may hear a few rings, it may not have rang on our end or only rang once. Your calls were only 35 & 33 seconds long.
If you private message us on here or email me at the email address above with the phone number you called from, we can look up the calls and see what happened.

Will you email me the issues you had: tpelt@mylubbock.us The phone rings a few times on your end before our dispatchers get the call. Sometimes people hang up after a few rings, not realizing they're hanging up before our dispatchers get the call. Was that the problem?

We'd like to thank everyone involved in the inaugural #MayorsMarathonLbk who made a success! In addition to the participants, volunteers, employees & sponsors, we also want to thank the citizens who worked with officers to take detours as the outer lanes of the loop were closed!

Ladies and gentlemen....THAT'S A WRAP! Not only has the last runner crossed the finish line, but the loop is BACK OPEN! Thank you so much for your patience & cooperation in helping to make the inaugural #MayorsMarathonLbk a complete SUCCESS!
East 4th street, Idalou Hwy. MLK Drive, up to North Ash Ave. along the loop are back open for drivers! #MayorsMarathonLbk
More openings coming your way! Spur 331, East 50th, and East 19th streets are back open for business! #MayorsMarathonLbk
Now we're just adding to the list of re-openings...University Avenue, I-27, and Slaton Hwy. along the South/Southeast Loop are back open #MayorsMarathonLbk
Spur 327, Slide, Quaker, and Indiana Avenues are back open. We're making progress! #MayorsMarathonLbk
34th street, Marsha Sharp, and 50th street along the loop are all back open as well! #MayorsMarathonLbk
The re-opening of the loop continues! Frankford & 19th street are open once again #MayorsMarathonLbk

The loop is beginning the first round of re-opening! Right now, officers have opened Erskine, North Quaker and North Slide! We appreciate your patience as we work to continue opening the loop! #MayorsMarathonLbk
We've got to tip our hats to the volunteers at the #firstaidstations as they're breaking down their stations very quickly as the last runners pass by. Talk about efficiency! #MayorsMarathonLbk
Look at them go! Chief Stevens is out encouraging some of the runners as they get started this morning #MayorsMarathonLbk

The #halfmarathon of the #MayorsMarathonLbk is now underway!

And they're off! The very first #MayorsMarathonLbk is officially underway! Don't forget the OUTER lanes of the loop are CLOSED until further notice to keep runners safe! Officers are posted around the loop to direct you where you need to go in the meantime
5 minutes out from the beginning of the inaugural #MayorsMarathonLbk

Clovis Rd. turning into Berl Huffman park is a little backed up right now. Please be patient as our officers work to clear the congestion and get everyone where they need to be! #MayorsMarathonLbk
We are now 30 mins. away from the kick-off of the #MayorsMarathonLbk 2018! Please be aware that the OUTER lanes of the loop are shut down for runners, as you head out this morning!

With the loop shut down and the race beginning at 7:30 our officers have a few minutes to make sure everything is set up EXACTLY like it needs to be! We couldn't do this without @cityoflubbock @TxDOTLubbock @LubbockFire and everyone else who is working so hard! #MayorsMarathonLbk

Did you know that so much planning has gone in to the #MayorsMarathonLbk that our operations center was able to let our officers know at the EXACT moment a train would be coming by! #precisionpolicing

Our officers have made it safe for volunteers to set up #firstaidstations along the loop at every mile for the #MayorsMarathonLbk They're setting up now to make sure everything is ready to go for the start of the races!

APRIL 3RD we will shut down 2 areas for crash investigations: 9am-noon: intersection of 82nd & Ave.U will be shut down. 1pm-4pm: all lanes of traffic of 19th St. from Utica to Slide will be shut down for Sunday's fatal crash. We will update Twitter when the roads are reopened.
CRASH UPDATE 2: all lanes of 19th Street are back open. The fatal crash remains under investigation.

Just before 6 p.m. today, LPD Accident Investigators arrested 46yr old Melvin Keele for Failure to Stop and Render Aid in the hit & run crash that killed 18yr old Joey Aguero back on Feb. 1st in the 7000 block of 4th St. This case remains under investigation.

Our #FridayFavorite is from last week's Class 2017B Graduation! These 22 rookies are now in the Field Training Officer (FTO) phase where they are paired w/ a veteran officer while they patrol the streets. Check out the other pics on our LPD Facebook Page

This is an important reminder from the #LubbockCountySheriffsOffice as we enter tax season! Remember, NO law enforcement officer will ever ask you to pay a "fine" to dismiss a warrant! If this happens to you, please report it! #SeeSomethingSaySomething

Here are a few of our favorites from Sgt. Jimmy Pachall's retirement yesterday. He joined LPD in '89 & served the LBK Community for 29 years! And yes, that mullet was well within policy back in the 90's! Enjoy your retirement, your laughter will be greatly missed around LPD!

UPDATE: Our officers have responded to 170 to 200 crashes since 2a.m. Of those, 42 crashes had reported injuries, but luckily all were minor. It looks like the crash volume is easing up, but we still ask drivers to take it slow & keep an eye on the road conditions.

Since 2am, our officers have responded to more than 150 traffic crashes. The majority of these are due to icy conditions & most are occuring on Marsha Sharp, Loop 289 & I-27. We have a few on-ramps to these roads shut down. Please avoid bridges, overpass & flyovers this morning.

TAKE IT SLOW. We're seeing icy roads this morning. Our officers have already responded to NUMEROUS crashes due to slick conditions. Please avoid all bridges, overpasses and flyovers on Marsha Sharp, Loop 289 & I-27.
#Lbk has been lucky so far that we haven't seen any extreme weather, other than the cold, but our chances for freezing precip continue through tomorrow! So remember these tips to stay safe!
Please keep this in mind for your morning commutes! Give yourself plenty of time to make it to work and school due to the possibility of slick roads.

It has been a sad week for law enforcement. Another brother in blue has been lost. This time, several hours away in Richardson, Texas. Our thoughts are with the Richardson Police Department during this heartbreaking time.

Our #WantedWednesday suspect is no stranger to our list. Isaias Cabello is still wanted for the Dec. 2015 murder of Henry Anderson. #CrimeLine callers w/ info leading to his arrest could be eligible for a $5000 cash reward. Callers can remain anonymous. Call 806-741-1000 w/ info
Our hearts are heavy and our thoughts are with our brothers and sisters at the El Paso County Sheriff's Office. Deputy Flick was killed in the line of duty yesterday afternoon.

We'd like to take a minute to show the #HubCity this gem of a #TBT! You don't see many pictures like this anymore! If you happen to come across a picture with as much history as this one, we'd love to see it!

Malcolm Bibbs, 42, was arrested today for the murder of 43yr old Raymond Lockett on Jan. 20th. Investigators identified Bibbs as the suspect after learning there had been an ongoing dispute between the men. A big thank you to LSO & US Marshals who also assisted w/ the arrest.

Thanks so much Officer Reedy for the presentation you did today about internet safety! The big takeaways?! Be impactful, images are forever, think before you post, & your future depends on the decisions you make now!

UPDATE: We have no reports of injuries. However our SWAT team is still on scene and we ask that you avoid the area of 5400 Kemper as we investigate reports of a male firing multiple gunshots.
